page.title: 05SUNNYDALE(Local Beauty Spot)
page.content: There used to be a cloth mill that changed to producing bank notes there.The mill was water powered that is why there is a damn there.The damn is surrounded by mixed woodland and farmland,and is in a small valley.The walls of the damn are now in danger of collapsing,and is owned by the Water board.The water of the damn runs down a small stream from the moor.In the damn there are Rainbow and Brown trout, there are also Bream and some more common small fish,and they are caught by a fishing club. Around the damn,being mixed woodland,there is a wide variety of wild life,including small animals, dragonflies and alot of bird life. This is an ideal place for family outings and picnics. Some of the large slabs of stone and foundations of the mill still remain.
